data.title: Kalamazoo's top storylines from the winter sports season
data.meta_description: Follow along to see the top performances and players that made the 2016-17 winter sports season a memorable one.
data.text:
Kalamazoo Central's Isaiah Livers (2) dunks during a game against rival Loy Norrix in the Western Michigan University Field house on January 20, 2017. (JakeGreen/MLive.com)

By Patrick Nothaft | pnothaft@mlive.com

KALAMAZOO, MI â€“ Whether it was on the high school, college or professional level, the 2016-17 winter sports season gave area fans plenty to cheer about. Before we get too far into spring, let's take a look back at some of the top moments from the recent past.

Kalamazoo Central's Isaiah Livers accepts the 2017 Hal Schram Mr. Basketball Award in Detroit Monday March 20, 2017. (Tanya Moutzalias | MLive Detroit)

Kalamazoo Central's Isaiah Livers is Mr. Basketball

One of the area's historically good high school basketball programs, Kalamazoo Central added another award to its trophy case, as the 6-foot-8 University of Michigan signee earned the annual award in the closest race since its inception 37 years ago.

Louisville sophomore Mallory Comerford reacts to her first-place finish in the 200 freestyle during the NCAA Division I women's swimming national championships. (Used with permission from University of Louisville)

Mallory Comerford wins national championship against Olympic competition

The Plainwell High School grad and current University of Louisville swimmer won an NCAA Division 1 swim national championship in the 200 freestyle by tying five-time Olympic gold medalist Katie Ledecky for first place.

Western Michigan quarterback Zach Terrell (11) runs the ball into the end zone for a touchdown during the 81st annual Goodyear Cotton Bowl Classic at AT&T Stadium in Arlington, Texas, on Monday, Jan. 2, 2017. The Wisconsin Badgers beat the Western Michigan Broncos 24-16. (Chelsea Purgahn/Kalamazoo Gazette)

WMU hangs tough with Wisconsin in 2017 Cotton Bowl

The best season in Western Michigan football history ended with a loss, but it was far from a sour note, as the Broncos hung with Wisconsin before falling short 24-16 in the Cotton Bowl Classic on Jan. 2.

Western Michigan coach P.J. Fleck talks to the media during the final pre-game Cotton Bowl press conference at the Omni Dallas Hotel Jan. 1, 2017(Cory Olsen | MLive.com)

PJ Fleck leaves WMU for Minnesota

Everyone knew it would happen sooner or later, and it did on Jan. 6, as Broncos head football coach P.J. Fleck announced he accepted a job offer from Minnesota. The position would remain open for seven days, untilâ€¦

From left to right: Western Michigan University President John Dunn, Athletic Director Kathy Beauregard, Tim Lester and Dawn Lester pose for photos during a press conference Saturday morning. (JakeGreen/MLive.com)

Tim Lester hired as WMU football coach

The former Broncos quarterback returned to his alma mater on Jan. 13, when the university announced his hiring for its vacant football head coaching position. Lester became the 16th coach to lead the Broncos since they started playing football in 1906.

Denver Pioneers' Emil Romig and Broncos' Jade McMullen, right, fight for the puck during a Saturday night game in Lawson Ice Arena on January 14, 2017. (JakeGreen/MLive.com)

WMU men's ice hockey team defeats top-ranked Denver

Sticking with the Broncos' theme, there were few wins more memorable for the WMU men's ice hockey team this season than its 3-0 win over No. 1 Denver on Jan. 13. The Pioneers would go on to win the 2017 NCAA championship.

Tony Huggett proposes marriage to Brittnie Raggl as hundreds of Chicago Cubs pack into Kalamazoo's Cityscape Events Center, 125 S. Kalamazoo Mall. (Mark Bugnaski | MLive.com)

Chicago Cubs World Series Trophy visits Kalamazoo

One of the best national sports stories of 2016, the Chicago Cubs shared a piece of their World Series experience with the organization's West Michigan fan base by making two stops in the Mitten State on Feb. 20. The Commissioner's Trophy first spent three hours in St. Joseph, then three hours in Kalamazoo, drawing nearly 2,000 fans throughout the day.

K-Wings goalie Joel Martin scans the ice in a game against the Ft. Wayne Komets at Wings Event Center.

(Photo by John Gilroy)

Joel Martin sets K-Wings career wins record

Veteran goaltender Joel Martin stamped his name in the Kalamazoo Wings history book on Jan. 6 by becoming the franchise's leader in career wins. His 197th victory with the K-Wings broke a 30-year record previously held by Georges Gagnon.

Kalamazoo Central's Isaiah Livers is greeted by a teammate during introductions to the Maroon Giants' Class A boys basketball regional semifinal game against Holt on Monday, March 13 at Gull Lake High School. (Patrick Nothaft | MLive.com)

Kalamazoo Gazette names high school Winter Athletes of the Year

From basketball to wrestling and everything in between, the Kalamazoo Gazette picked eight high school athletes to represent their respective sports as the Winter Athletes of the Year.

Bangor's Devon Kozel tosses Springport's Nick Cooper during their 215-pound MHSAA Division 4 individual wrestling championships at the Palace of Auburn Hills in Auburn Hills, on Saturday, March 4, 2017. (Mac Snyder | MLive.com)

Bangor's Devon Kozel wins state title

The senior wrestler defeated defending state champion Nick Cooper, of Springport, three times over the course of the season, including a 9-3 decision in the 189-point Division 4 state championship match.

Allegan's Chase Beard gets emotional after defeating Cedar Springs' Patrick DePiazza during their 285-pound MHSAA Division 2 individual wrestling championships at the Palace of Auburn Hills in Auburn Hills, on Saturday, March 4, 2017. (Mac Snyder | MLive.com)

Allegan's Chase Beard wins heavyweight state title

The Allegan senior capped a four-year journey to the top of podium by defeating longtime rival Pat DePiazza, of Cedar Springs, in the Division 2 heavyweight title bout. Beard's state championship win came a little more than one year after he tore his ACL in a match during his junior season.

Mendon's Syler Crespo celebrates after defeating Erie Mason's Robert LeFevre during their 125-pound MHSAA Division 4 individual wrestling championships at the Palace of Auburn Hills in Auburn Hills, on Saturday, March 4, 2017. (Mac Snyder | MLive.com)

Mendon freshman Skyler Crespo wins state title

The Hornets have had their share of outstanding high school wrestlers, including three-time state champion Jason Bingaman, but never have they produced a freshman state champion. Until Skyler Crespo came around, that is. The 125-pound freshman defeated Erie Mason's Robert LeFevre 3-1 in the Division 4 title match.

Carson Meulenberg (24) of Covenant Christian boys basketball plays against Drew Scheffers (21) of Kalamazoo Christian for the Class C state quarterfinal at Holland West Ottawa High School on March 21, 2017 in Holland. (Daytona Niles | MLive.com)

Kalamazoo Christian upsets Schoolcraft in boys playoff basketball

Schoolcraft entered its March 13 regional showdown with Kalamazoo Christian sporting a 22-1 record that included a 36-point victory over the Comets earlier in the season, bu the Eagles weren't intimidating anyone on this day. Kalamazoo Christian's Jordan Katje forced overtime with a layup to beat the fourth-quarter buzzer, and the Comets went on to control the extra session and pull out a 53-47 win.

Central's Austin McCullough receives a commemorative ball before his team's game against Portage Northern at Portage Central High School on Friday, Feb. 17, 2017. (Jake Green | MLive.com)

Austin McCullough sets Portage Central scoring record

The Portage Central senior moved to Michigan from Alabama prior to his ninth-grade year, and within four years, his name is atop a list of greatest Mustang basketball players ever. McCullough broke the Portage Central scoring record, then became the first Mustang to reach 1,0000 points on Feb. 15 against Battle Creek Lakeview.

Cassopolis players run to the sidelines to do stretches before a MHSAA football playoff game at Decatur High School on Friday, Nov. 11, 2016. Cassopolis is one of 10 schools exploring the option of joining a new conference next season. (Chelsea Purgahn | MLive.com)

Southwest Michigan schools combine to form state's newest athletic conference

Several Kalamazoo-area teams will have new homes next year with the creation of the Southwest 10 athletic conference, which formed in January from teams opting out of the Southwestern Athletic Conference and the Berrien-Cass-St. Joseph leagues. All changes will take effect in the fall of 2017.

Plainwell native Trevor Millard poses for a picture after breaking the 20-year-old Kalamazoo Metro Bowling Association series record on Wednesday, Feb. 22. (Photo used with permission from Scott Brunner)

Plainwell grad sets bowling record

Singer songwriter Meatloaf once said, "Two out of three ain't bad." That turns out to be a true statement at the bowling alley when two of your three games are 300s and the other is a 279. That 879 series, rolled by 2016 Plainwell graduate Trevor Millard on Feb. 22 at Continental Lanes, broke a 20-year-old city record and an 11-year-old alley record.

West Team Stars All-Star Women's basketball play against Grace Smith (12) of Kalamazoo and East Team Stripes All-Star in the ADDIX Basketball Champions All-Star Game at Davenport University on March 29, 2017. (Daytona Niles | MLive.com)

Kalamazoo College's Grace Smith named to national service team
